Self Assessment Template: Math

I want to teach you how to assess your own knowledge about a subject area. Letâ€™s do this by taking an example that you already know. Suppose you wanted to assess your own knowledge about solving 2-step equations of the form ax + b = c. An example of this type of problem is 2x + 3 = 15.

Types of Knowledge

  • Facts: Concepts you have that describe objects or elements.
  • Strategies: General processes to solve a problem.
  • Procedures: Specific steps used in a strategy.
  • Rationales: Reasons why strategies or procedures work.

Self Assessment Example

Facts

Variables, constants, coefficients, equations, and expressions. Examples:
Variable: An unknown quantity, usually represented by a letter.
Constant: A specific number.
Coefficient: A number multiplied by a variable.
Equation: An expression equal to another expression.
Expression: One or more terms combined using mathematical operations.

Strategies

Reverse order of operations: SADMEP (Subtraction, Addition, Division, Multiplication, Exponents, Parentheses). Example: Unsure about order of subtraction vs. addition or division vs. multiplication.

Procedures

Additive inverse: Adding the opposite sign constant to both sides.
\n Multiplicative inverse: Multiplying both sides by the inverse of the coefficient. Question: Should the inverse be negative if the coefficient is negative?

Rationales

Subtraction property of equality: Subtracting the same number preserves equality.
\n Division property of equality: Dividing by the same number preserves equality.

Summary

\n Review your understanding of facts, strategies, procedures, and rationales. Identify areas where you need further learning and focus on addressing gaps.\n

\n\n\n
